info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 4:50AM EDT until July 10 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... * Until 800 AM EDT. * At 450 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Areas hard hit by heavy rain yesterday are especially prone to flooding. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Torrington, New Milford, Kent, Sharon, Norfolk, Canaan, Cornwall Bridge, Falls Village, New Preston, Gaylordsville, Salisbury, Goshen, Warren, Cornwall, Dean Corners, Corner Of The Pines, Cornwall Bridge Pottery, West Cornwall, Emmons Corners and Cornwall Center. This includes the following streams and drainages... Bonney Brook, Doolittle Lake Brook, Bantam River, Mudge Pond Brook, West Aspetuck River, Housatonic River, Wimisink Brook, Factory Brook, Birdseye Brook, Pond Mountain Brook, Sandy Brook, Walker Brook, Hollenbeck River, Webatuck Creek, Konkapot River, West Side Pond Brook, Cross Brook, Butternut Brook, Naugatuck River, East Aspetuck River, East Branch Shepaug River, Hatch Brook, Brassi Brook, Ocain Brook, Brown Brook, Hop Brook, Nickel Mine Brook, Pine Swamp Brook, Kent Falls Brook, Bullymuck Brook, Bash Bish Brook, Mad River, West Branch Shepaug River, Fox Brook, Mallory Brook, Indian Lake Creek, Ledgy Brook, Still River, Mauwee Brook, Wachocastinook Creek, Furnace Brook, West Branch Butternut Brook, Mill Brook, Spruce Swamp Creek, Bog Hollow Brook, Tannery Brook, North Kent Brook, Ball Brook, Drake Pond Brook, Whiting River, Dry Brook and Bee Brook. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
